string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Video: Part 1 - Prepare Your File: Transfer to Adobe Illustrator
Video: Part 2 - Prepare Your File: Adobe Illustrator Adjustments
Video: Part 3 - Prepare Your File: Send to CutStudio
Video: Part 4 - Prepare Your File: Set Up in CutStudio

Title Page: Set Up in CutStudio

search.slidetext: prepare your file next next next
next next next back back back back back back back prepare your file: transfer to adobe illustrator (part 1/4)
next next next back back back back back back back prepare your file: adobe illustrator adjustments (part 2/4)
next next next back back back back back back back prepare your file: send to cutstudio (part 3/4)
next next next back back back back back back back prepare your file: set up in cutstudio (part 4/4)

prepare your file: prepare to review next next next back back back back back back back review slides we’ll now review the steps to follow when preparing your file for vinyl cutting using adobe illustrator and cutstudio. after you review, you’ll have the chance to check-in on your understanding. select the “next” button when you are ready to continue.
part 1: transfer to adobe illustrator prepare your file: part 1: transfer to adobe illustrator next next next back back back back back back back

prepare your file: transfer to adobe illustrator (part 1/4) “transfer to adobe illustrator” steps 1. click the icon to open adobe illustrator. 2. select “file” from the top menu and click “new.” 3. select one of the custom preset sizes and select “create.” 4. navigate back to the “choose a vector file” module. open the google drive link that holds multiple vector file images. 5. find your chosen image. click on the three dots that appear next to the title. select “download” from the menu that appears. 6. open the “file explorer” at the bottom of the screen and click “downloads.” 7. the most recent download that appears will be your chosen image. drag and drop that image onto the adobe illustrator artboard. back back back back back back back next next next
part 2: adobe illustrator adjustments prepare your file: part 2: adobe illustrator adjustments next next next back back back back back back back

prepare your file: adobe illustrator adjustments (part 2/4) ”adobe illustrator adjustments” steps 1. select your image by clicking “ctrl + a” on the pc keyboard (please see “prepare your file job aid for selection tool instructions linked in the final slide) 2. lock the aspect ratio (the ratio of height to width) by clicking the aspect ratio icon next to the dimensions. 3. type your desired height or width into the dimensions box. adobe illustrator will automatically resize the other dimension if the aspect ratio is locked. 4. drag and drop your image into the bottom left corner of the artboard. 5. adjust the “fill” and “stroke” (the outline) settings in the “properties” tab under “appearance.” 6. select “fill” and make it transparent by selecting the white box with a red line through it. 7. adjust the “stroke.” the default for stroke is transparent, so first give it a stroke, and then make it very thin - 0.001 inches. back back back back back back back next next next
part 3: send to cutstudio prepare your file: part 3: send to cutstudio next next next back back back back back back back

prepare your file: send to cutstudio (part 3/4) ”send to cutstudio” steps 1. ensure the roland cutstudio extension is open in adobe illustrator. you may see it in the upper right side of your screen. 2. if you don’t see it, click “window” in the top menu bar, select “extensions,” and select “roland cutstudio” from the menu that appears. 3. if the section with “roland cutstudio” disappears at any time, click “window” in the top menu bar and select “properties” from the menu that appears. 4. ensure your design is selected by looking at the roland cutstudio preview box. if the image does not appear, you can select the design again by clicking “ctrl+a” or by using the selection tool. 5. select the gs-24 vinyl cutter in the roland cutstudio extension. 6. click on the capital “r” icon. cutstudio will load and your design will appear on the cutstudio screen. back back back back back back back next next next
part 4: set up in cutstudio prepare your file: part 4: set up in cutstudio next next next back back back back back back back

prepare your file: set up in cutstudio (part 4/4) ”send to cutstudio” steps 1. select your image by clicking “ctrl +a.” 2. select the checkmark next to “keep aspect” to ensure the image doesn’t distort. 3. connect the vinyl cutter and the laptop with cutstudio open together with a usb cord. 4. select “file.” from the menu that appears, select “cutting setup.” 5. in the “cutting setup” window, select “roland gs-24.” back back back back back back back next next next

prepare your file: prepare for understanding check-in questions next next next back back back back back back back understanding check-in questions now let’s check in on your understanding. the following questions are intended to help you review the steps we’ve covered. select the “next” button when you are ready to continue.

nice attempt, but not quite. let’s try again. feel free to review the ”transfer to adobe illustrator” video or slide if needed. try again try again try again try again try again try again try again nice attempt, but not quite. let’s try again. feel free to review the ”transfer to adobe illustrator” video or slide if needed. try again try again try again try again try again try again try again nice job! after you click the “ai” icon to open adobe illustrator, click “file.” from the menu that appears, click “new.” continue continue continue continue continue continue continue select “file” from the top menu select “file” from the top menu select “file” from the top menu select “file” from the top menu select “file” from the top menu select “file” from the top menu click “window” and look for “extensions” in the menu that appears click “window” and look for “extensions” in the menu that appears click “window” and look for “extensions” in the menu that appears click “window” and look for “extensions” in the menu that appears click “window” and look for “extensions” in the menu that appears click “window” and look for “extensions” in the menu that appears select “edit” from the top menu select “edit” from the top menu select “edit” from the top menu select “edit” from the top menu select “edit” from the top menu select “edit” from the top menu after you open adobe illustrator, what step will you take next to open an artboard for your design? prepare your file: understanding check-in #1 next next next back back back back back back back understanding check-in click the bubble next to your chosen answer to receive feedback.

not quite, where might you click to create an artboard? try again try again try again try again try again try again try again that's right! select “create” once you’ve picked the preset size that will work for your design. continue continue continue continue continue continue continue prepare your file: understanding check-in #2 back back back back back back back next next next once you’ve selected a preset size, where do you click to open your artboard? understanding check-in click the area on the image to the right to receive feedback.

not quite, feel free to review the “adobe illustrator adjustments” video or slide to review if needed. try again try again try again try again try again try again try again that's right! clicking this area will lock the aspect ratio, ensuring that the ratio of height to width is maintained. continue continue continue continue continue continue continue prepare your file: understanding check-in #3 back back back back back back back next next next clicking what area would have locked the aspect ratio and prevented distortion when the image was resized? understanding check-in click the area on the image to the right to receive feedback.

nice try, but not quite! let’s try again. feel free to review the “adobe illustrator adjustments” video or slide if needed. try again try again try again try again try again try again try again well done! selecting the white box with a red line through it will make your “fill” transparent. this prepares your file to be read by the vinyl cutter. continue continue continue continue continue continue continue the white box with a red line through it the white box with a red line through it the white box with a red line through it the white box with a red line through it the white box with a red line through it the white box with a red line through it the black box the black box the black box the black box the black box the black box the box with a file icon the box with a file icon the box with a file icon the box with a file icon the box with a file icon the box with a file icon to make the “fill” transparent, what box do you select? understanding check-in the paintbrush icon the paintbrush icon the paintbrush icon the paintbrush icon the paintbrush icon the paintbrush icon next next next back back back back back back back vinyl cutter safety: protect the environment prepare your file: understanding check-in #4 click the bubble next to your chosen answer to receive feedback.

nice try, but not quite! let’s try again. feel free to review the “send to cutstudio” video or slide if needed. try again try again try again try again try again try again try again well done! if you don’t see the roland cutstudio extension, first select “window.” from the menu that appears, select “extensions.” then select “roland cutstudio” from the menu that appears. continue continue continue continue continue continue continue file file file file file file window window window window window window if the roland cutstudio extension is not available when you open adobe illustrator, what do you select from the top menu in order to access “extensions?” understanding check-in edit edit edit edit edit edit next next next back back back back back back back vinyl cutter safety: protect the environment prepare your file: understanding check-in #5 click the bubble next to your chosen answer to receive feedback.

nice try, but not quite! let’s try again. feel free to review the “adobe illustrator adjustments” and “set up in cutstudio” videos and slides if needed. try again try again try again try again try again try again try again well done! selecting “ctrl + a” on your keyboard selects your whole design. continue continue continue continue continue continue continue ctrl + v ctrl + v ctrl + v ctrl + v ctrl + v ctrl + v ctrl + c ctrl + c ctrl + c ctrl + c ctrl + c ctrl + c ctrl + a ctrl + a ctrl + a ctrl + a ctrl + a ctrl + a what keyboard shortcut helps you select your file (in both adobe illustrator and cutstudio)? understanding check-in ctrl + z ctrl + z ctrl + z ctrl + z ctrl + z ctrl + z next next next back back back back back back back vinyl cutter safety: protect the environment prepare your file: understanding check-in #6 click the bubble next to your chosen answer to receive feedback.

nice try, but not quite! let’s try again. feel free to review the “set up in cutstudio” video or slide if needed. try again try again try again try again try again try again try again well done! select “cutting setup” from the menu that appears when you click “file.” continue continue continue continue continue continue continue cutting preview cutting preview cutting preview cutting preview cutting preview cutting preview cutting setup cutting setup cutting setup cutting setup cutting setup cutting setup print and cut print and cut print and cut print and cut print and cut print and cut after you’ve opened your image in cutstudio, what “file” menu item will you select to prepare your image for vinyl cutting? understanding check-in cutting cutting cutting cutting cutting cutting next next next back back back back back back back vinyl cutter safety: protect the environment prepare your file: understanding check-in #7 click the bubble next to your chosen answer to receive feedback.

prepare your file: congratulations! references references references back back back back back back back great job completing the “prepare your file” module. in the next module, we’ll learn how to cut our sticker! see you soon! well done!
